commit_message:
Cinder storage aggregate

In a large-scale cloud, there are thousands of storage backends with
different features or something else, such as performance, available
and so on. Volume types for Cinder are equal to host aggregates for
Nova in a way, which are used to aggregate storage backends with different
features or something else. But some customized features are usually
configured in cinder.conf, so we have to restart cinder-volume service
for customized features changes. If we use storage aggregates, we can
use command line without restarting cinder-volume service.

Change-Id: I083a320cf896b35ff903564f583eeb15ab66a58e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/83/476883/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================= Support Cinder storage aggregates ================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/cinder-storage-aggregates Add storage aggregates for Cinder, as host aggregates for Nova. Problem description =================== In a large-scale cloud, there are thousands of storage backends with a lot of types, such as Ceph RBD, EMC, IBM and so on. As we usually create volume with a specific volume type, one volume type for one storage backend may be inconvenience, so one volume type for multi-backends is recommended. In the case, storage aggregate is recommended to schedule storage backends. Use Cases ========= Use storage aggregate to schedule storage backends. Proposed change =============== 1. cinder aggregate-create <name> [<availability-zone>] Create a new aggregate with the specified details. Positional arguments: <name> Name of aggregate. Optional arguments: <availability-zone> The availability zone of the aggregate. 2. cinder aggregate-delete <aggregate> Delete the aggregate. Positional arguments: <aggregate> Name or ID of aggregate to delete. 3. cinder aggregate-list Print a list of all aggregates. 4. cinder aggregate-show <aggregate> Show details of the specified aggregate. Positional arguments: <aggregate> Name or ID of aggregate. 5. nova aggregate-update [--name NAME] [--availability-zone <availability-zone>] <aggregate> Update the aggregate's name and optionally availability zone. Positional arguments: <aggregate> Name or ID of aggregate to update. Optional arguments: --name NAME New name for aggregate. --availability-zone <availability-zone> New availability zone for aggregate. 6. cinder aggregate-set-metadata <aggregate> <key=value> [<key=value> ...] Update the metadata associated with the aggregate. Positional arguments: <aggregate> Name or ID of aggregate to update. <key=value> Metadata to add/update to aggregate. Specify only the key to delete a metadata item. 7. cinder aggregate-add-storage <aggregate> <storage> Add the storage to the specified aggregate. Positional arguments: <aggregate> Name or ID of aggregate. <storage> The storage to add to the aggregate. 8. cinder aggregate-remove-storage <aggregate> <storage> Remove the specified storage from the specified aggregate. Positional arguments: <aggregate> Name or ID of aggregate. <storage> The storage to remove from the aggregate. 9. AggregateVolumeTypeExtraSpecsFilter 10. AggregateMultiTenancyIsolationFilter Alternatives ------------ None. Data model impact ----------------- One volume type for multi-backends may impact volume consistency group, which requires one volume type for one backend. REST API impact --------------- This will introduce at least the 8 new calls mentioned in the proposal section, these will be part of a new API object named aggregate. We'll treat the aggregate as a first class object in Cinder. The new API will be released under a new microversion. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- The new API will be exposed to users via the python-cinderclient. Performance Impact ------------------ While it is doing a db operation it should be a very low impact. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Dongdong Pei Work Items ---------- * Implement API calls and wrappers in Cinder * Implement cinderclient calls to expose them * Implement changes in Cinder * Implement AggregateVolumeTypeExtraSpecsFilter * Implement AggregateMultiTenancyIsolationFilter Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= * Unit tests in Cinder. * Tempest tests in Cinder. * Functional tests in Cinder. * Unit tests in python-cinderclient. Documentation Impact ==================== New admin docs to explain how to use the API. References ========== [1] https://docs.openstack.org/cli-reference/nova.html

commit_message:
Get rid of sourcing stackrc in grenade settings

Instead, use the common_settings file to source all the variables
we need at the early stages of devstack setup and during the upgrade
itself. This also fixes an issue with the networking-generic-switch
upgrade script, which is run from the old release instead of the new
one.

Change-Id: If63779ced5e99461782c65188f4776045df85125

commit_message:
cisco zone driver can't support multi-fabric with same vsan

If multi-fabric with different ip have the same zoning_vsan, device_map
only return the last fabric's fabric_map. This may lead to missing other
fabric_map.In line 171, we change device_map[zoning_vsan] = fabric_map to
device_map[fabric_name] = fabric_map, which may correct the problem.

cinder/zonemanager/drivers/cisco/cisco_fc_san_lookup_service.py

74     def get_device_mapping_from_network(self,
75                                         initiator_wwn_list,
76                                         target_wwn_list):
......
114         if fabrics:
......
121             for fabric_name in fabrics:
......
171                 device_map[zoning_vsan] = fabric_map
......
173         return device_map

cinder.conf
[DEFAULT]
......
[fc-zone-manager]
......
fc_fabric_names = CISCO_FABRIC_A,CISCO_FABRIC_B
......
[CISCO_FABRIC_A]
......
cisco_fc_fabric_address = IP_A
cisco_zoning_vsan = same_vsan

[CISCO_FABRIC_B]
......
cisco_fc_fabric_address = IP_B
cisco_zoning_vsan = same_vsan

Change-Id: I02a719d3ba724c0eb6c468062d648b243f62e08e
Closes-Bug: #1704143

commit_message:
add cyborg-api v1 & hooks

add these for further expansion:
1. give an initial version of v1 to api service,
2. add Config and PublicUrl hook to app.
3. add resource endpoint in response body.

Change-Id: I2b84508a07bbbf0f5133c828a8217a23398564db

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import pecan from wsme import types as wtypes from cyborg.api.controllers import base def build_url(resource, resource_args, bookmark=False, base_url=None): if base_url is None: base_url = pecan.request.public_url template = '%(url)s/%(res)s' if bookmark else '%(url)s/v1/%(res)s' template += '%(args)s' if resource_args.startswith('?') else '/%(args)s' return template % {'url': base_url, 'res': resource, 'args': resource_args} class Link(base.APIBase): """A link representation.""" href = wtypes.text """The url of a link.""" rel = wtypes.text """The name of a link.""" type = wtypes.text """Indicates the type of document/link.""" @staticmethod def make_link(rel_name, url, resource, resource_args, bookmark=False, type=wtypes.Unset): href = build_url(resource, resource_args, bookmark=bookmark, base_url=url) return Link(href=href, rel=rel_name, type=type)

commit_message:
SMBFS: enable thin provisioning support flag

This change enables the thin provisioning support flag for the
SMBFS driver.

Note that we're currently using dynamic VHD/x images for storing
volume data, also reporting the configured max oversubscription ratio.
Properly setting this flag will avoid scheduling issues.

Closes-Bug: #1710229

Change-Id: I31ab4dd472856e85e61d668a2fcf1f4321046385

commit_message:
CI/OOOQ compatibility in enable-ssh-admin script

We need to default $OVERCLOUD_HOSTS to Overcloud_hosts, since that's
how OOOQ approaches the host lists after refactoring in
I55f705a390ae5b927a9fb0f8d8ec153ea61cc3c9.

Defaulting OVERCLOUD_SSH_KEY to SUBNODES_SSH_KEY is also for
compatibility with CI. We already had this before, this commit just
refactors the code to get rid of the extra variable.

Change-Id: I9042b097dd6c27c19fe2aaba40bb60136570b5ec
Related-Bug: #1711559
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/60/495160/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: OVERCLOUD_HOSTS=${OVERCLOUD_HOSTS:-""}# this is just for compatibility with CI SUBNODES_SSH_KEY=${SUBNODES_SSH_KEY:-"$HOME/.ssh/id_rsa"} # this is the intended variable for overriding OVERCLOUD_SSH_KEY=${OVERCLOUD_SSH_KEY:-"$SUBNODES_SSH_KEY"}

commit_message:
Restore and split nova metadata docker service out of nova-api.

I2c39a2957fd95dd261b5b8c4df5e66e00a68d2f7 changed nova api to http from
eventlet, however we need to continue running the eventlet service as
it is required for the nova metadata api.

However this should be tied to the OS::TripleO::Services::NovaMetadata
service, so duplicate the required config in nova-metadata.yaml.

Change-Id: I398575d565d5527bcaa1c8b33b9de2e1e0f2f6fd
Depends-On: Id3407e151566d16c6ae1e1ea8c1b021dac22e727
Closes-bug: #1711425

commit_message:
Update and replace http with https for doc links in Cinder

1) Update doc links according to OpenStack document migration
2) Use https instead of http for docs links

Change-Id: I9b8473a439d15c741bc4d4809c4c4c122717f8a4

commit_message:
Add 'api_image_import' type to task(s) schemas

The glanceclient relies on the schemas being accurate so it can
format responses.  Without this update, admins won't be able to
use the glanceclient generate a task list containing the
api_image_import task that the task engine uses to process the
new image import process being introduced in Pike.

Closes-bug: #1711018

Change-Id: I5bcc9f4cdc55635809e8a90be555a367348a58c2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/63/494063/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix 500 error from image-stage call

Adds a RequestDeserializer for the stage and adjusts the image
status transitions so that they can handle the 'uploading' status
of an image with data in the stage.

Closes-bug: #1710958

Change-Id: I6f1cfe44a01542bc93a43cbd518956686adb366d

commit_message:
Clean up resources at shelve offload

Resource tracker doesn't clean up the resources of an instance after
it is offloaded since Ia93168b1560267178059284186fb2b7096c7e81f. So
this patch proposes an explicit cleanup in compute manager.

Closes-Bug: #1710249
Change-Id: Ib16e987d50162a4c11a31692704859b981915bed
(cherry picked from commit 563d71f7cc4742414be75332f1442f4ec6f5147b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/32/494632/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def delete_allocation_for_shelve_offloaded_instance(self, instance): res = self.reportclient.delete_allocation_for_instance(instance.uuid) if not res: LOG.error("Failed to clean allocation of a shelve offloaded " "instance", instance=instance)

commit_message:
TLS everywhere/docker: add nova services to environment

Most nova services are working with TLS everywhere, so they can be
added to the environment.

The compute and libvirt services are still pending.

bp tls-via-certmonger-containers

Change-Id: I80745fff5fbd9a6ccd701c1d154b38ad41b0cc3c

commit_message:
Adds 9.0 to release_mappings

We just released 9.0.0, so this adds '9.0' and 'pike' to the list of
releases that can be specified, for rolling upgrades.

Change-Id: Ib3d2c662f96c0c5eb308b3db5be1874dcc63a274

commit_message:
SSP Volume Adapter

The SSP volume adapter enables logical units created in a cluster
to be used by an instance.

The SSP volume adapter expects the connection info to contain the
required identification for an LU including the name and id.

Change-Id: Ib45bcedfd135467b487b8eafd224022b2b212d71
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/54/372254/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: lu_set = self._disconnect_volume_from_vios(match_func, instance, stg_ftsk) # Run the FeedTask if it was built locally if stg_ftsk.name == 'ssp': stg_ftsk.execute() return list(lu_set) def _disconnect_volume_from_vios(self, match_func, instance, stg_ftsk): lpar_uuid = vm.get_pvm_uuid(instance) return lu_set self._connect_lu_to_vios(disk_info.name, disk_info.udid, instance, stg_ftsk) # If the FeedTask was built locally, then run it immediately if stg_ftsk.name == 'ssp': stg_ftsk.execute() def _connect_lu_to_vios(self, lu_name, lu_udid, instance, stg_ftsk): """Connects the LU to the VIOS which are part of the cluster.""" lu = pvm_stg.LU.bld_ref(self.adapter, lu_name, lu_udid)
deleted_lines: lpar_uuid = vm.get_pvm_uuid(instance) # Run the FeedTask if it was built locally if stg_ftsk.name == 'ssp': stg_ftsk.execute() return list(lu_set) lu = pvm_stg.LU.bld_ref(self.adapter, disk_info.name, disk_info.udid) # If the FeedTask was built locally, then run it immediately if stg_ftsk.name == 'ssp': stg_ftsk.execute()

commit_message:
increase memory for undercloud

In these days, 8 gigs seem to be a bit low for the
undercloud node. During my tests, some tasks were
killed by oom_killer. Increasing this limit
should make deployments a bit more stable.

Change-Id: I78408580757eb7627c244c7416289e07dc1f2954

subject: Fix bug creating port in different projects fail in Admin panel
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-16 12:59:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/497f2e2dac1694bb9550bd53a32adbe3fa564719', 'message': 'Fix bug creating port in different projects fail in Admin panel

Prfeviously network_get() in Neutron API wrapper has a hard-coded
condition to retrieve subnet details. This causes a failure of
creating a port in a network owned by a different project in
the admin panel.

This commit changes the logic of network_get() to try to retrieve
subnet details as much as possible instead of applying a hard-coded
condition. It allows us to avoid mirroring the neutron behavior.

There are some cases where subnet detail cannot be retrieved.
If such case, the Neutron API wrapper now drops such subnets.
Returning only subnet ID(s) sounds meaningless in GUI perspective
and it is already done in network_list().

Change-Id: I7d1860c2748521dd2dc394dc2484d7d7570d4bb8
Closes-Bug: #1645708

commit_message:
Fix bug creating port in different projects fail in Admin panel

Prfeviously network_get() in Neutron API wrapper has a hard-coded
condition to retrieve subnet details. This causes a failure of
creating a port in a network owned by a different project in
the admin panel.

This commit changes the logic of network_get() to try to retrieve
subnet details as much as possible instead of applying a hard-coded
condition. It allows us to avoid mirroring the neutron behavior.

There are some cases where subnet detail cannot be retrieved.
If such case, the Neutron API wrapper now drops such subnets.
Returning only subnet ID(s) sounds meaningless in GUI perspective
and it is already done in network_list().

Change-Id: I7d1860c2748521dd2dc394dc2484d7d7570d4bb8
Closes-Bug: #1645708
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/05/446505/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _expand_subnet_on_networks(request, networks): # When the number of networks is small, use filter query # with network IDs. Note that there is no specifial meaning # of choosing '10' as threshold. It is just to avoid too long URI # when there are a lot of networks. if len(networks) < 10: filter_params = {'network_id': [n['id'] for n in networks]} else: filter_params = {} subnets = subnet_list(request, **filter_params) subnet_dict = dict([(s['id'], s) for s in subnets]) # Expand subnet list from subnet_id to values. for n in networks: # NOTE(amotoki): The following logic drops a subnet whose detail # cannot be retrieved. Returning only subnet ID is less meaningful in # GUI perspective. If it turns out a problem, let's revisit this then. # There are some cases where subnet detail is not avaialble. # One case is an external network. Subnet detail on an external # network is only visible to the network owner. # Another case is where a subnet is being deleted. A subnet can be # deleted after a network list is retrieved. # There may be other potential timing issues. n['subnets'] = [subnet_dict[s] for s in n.get('subnets', []) if s in subnet_dict] _expand_subnet_on_networks(request, networks) _expand_subnet_on_networks(request, [network])
deleted_lines: # Get subnet list to expand subnet info in network list. subnets = subnet_list(request) subnet_dict = dict([(s['id'], s) for s in subnets]) # Expand subnet list from subnet_id to values. for n in networks: # Due to potential timing issues, we can't assume the subnet_dict data # is in sync with the network data. n['subnets'] = [subnet_dict[s] for s in n.get('subnets', []) if s in subnet_dict] if request.user.tenant_id == network['tenant_id'] or network['shared']: # Since the number of subnets per network must be small, # call subnet_get() for each subnet instead of calling # subnet_list() once. network['subnets'] = [subnet_get(request, sid) for sid in network['subnets']]

commit_message:
Remove with_items from utility pip install

The utility container already combines all of the packages into one
install, and then it runs the entire grouped install across the
utility containers multiple times for each element in
utility_pip_packages.

Change-Id: I844c05f57fa8552bacb850b00b51a27354ff5e53

commit_message:
Make logging more readable

Replace formatting templates for commands from  `"{!r}"` to `u"{!s}"`
for better representation of commands with more than one line.

Change-Id: I76a29757d4faffff321cfa3df7e39190acbb406b
Co-Authored-By: Fedor Zhadaev <fzhadaev@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
test shelve and shelve offload with placement

The following 3 scenarios are covered by this patch:
* boot, shelve, unshelve, delete
* boot, shelve, shelve offload, unshelve on different host, delete
* boot, shelve, shelve offload, unshelve on the same host, delete

The second and the third scenarios are faulty and therefore those
test cases now assert the wrong behavior but contain the expected
behavior as commented out asserts.

Change-Id: Iaf88f8802a456d5e197b65405fa6959a2c514325
Related-Bug: 1710249
(cherry picked from commit 13c39b1e79fa4e4a697ec3df5bea9b2470cc3deb)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/31/494631/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _boot_then_shelve_and_check_allocations(self, hostname, rp_uuid): # avoid automatic shelve offloading self.flags(shelved_offload_time=-1) server = self._boot_and_check_allocations( self.flavor1, hostname) req = { 'shelve': {} } self.api.post_server_action(server['id'], req) self._wait_for_state_change(self.api, server, 'SHELVED') # the host should maintain the existing allocation for this instance # while the instance is shelved source_usages = self._get_provider_usages(rp_uuid) self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor1, source_usages) # Check that the server only allocates resource from the host it is # booted on allocations = self._get_allocations_by_server_uuid(server['id']) self.assertEqual(1, len(allocations)) allocation = allocations[rp_uuid]['resources'] self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor1, allocation) return server def test_shelve_unshelve(self): source_hostname = self.compute1.host source_rp_uuid = self._get_provider_uuid_by_host(source_hostname) server = self._boot_then_shelve_and_check_allocations( source_hostname, source_rp_uuid) req = { 'unshelve': {} } self.api.post_server_action(server['id'], req) self._wait_for_state_change(self.api, server, 'ACTIVE') # the host should have resource usage as the instance is ACTIVE source_usages = self._get_provider_usages(source_rp_uuid) self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor1, source_usages) # Check that the server only allocates resource from the host it is # booted on allocations = self._get_allocations_by_server_uuid(server['id']) self.assertEqual(1, len(allocations)) allocation = allocations[source_rp_uuid]['resources'] self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor1, allocation) self._delete_and_check_allocations( server, source_rp_uuid, source_rp_uuid) def _shelve_offload_and_check_allocations(self, server, source_rp_uuid): req = { 'shelveOffload': {} } self.api.post_server_action(server['id'], req) self._wait_for_state_change(self.api, server, 'SHELVED_OFFLOADED') source_usages = self._get_provider_usages(source_rp_uuid) # NOTE(gibi): this is bug 1710249 where shelve offload doesn't free up # the resources self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor1, source_usages) # NOTE(gibi): after fixing bug 1710249 the following should be true # after offload there should be no usages # self.assertEqual({'VCPU': 0, # 'MEMORY_MB': 0, # 'DISK_GB': 0}, # source_usages) # NOTE(gibi): this is bug 1710249 where shelve offload doesn't free up # the resources allocations = self._get_allocations_by_server_uuid(server['id']) self.assertEqual(1, len(allocations)) allocation = allocations[source_rp_uuid]['resources'] self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor1, allocation) # NOTE(gibi): after fixing bug 1710249 the following should be true # after offload there should be no allocations # self.assertEqual(0, len(allocations)) def test_shelve_offload_unshelve_diff_host(self): source_hostname = self.compute1.host source_rp_uuid = self._get_provider_uuid_by_host(source_hostname) server = self._boot_then_shelve_and_check_allocations( source_hostname, source_rp_uuid) self._shelve_offload_and_check_allocations(server, source_rp_uuid) # unshelve after shelve offload will do scheduling. this test case # wants to test the scenario when the scheduler select a different host # to ushelve the instance. So we disable the original host. source_service_id = self.admin_api.get_services( host=source_hostname, binary='nova-compute')[0]['id'] self.admin_api.put_service(source_service_id, {'status': 'disabled'}) req = { 'unshelve': {} } self.api.post_server_action(server['id'], req) server = self._wait_for_state_change(self.api, server, 'ACTIVE') # unshelving an offloaded instance will call the scheduler so the # instance might end up on a different host current_hostname = server['OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host'] self.assertEqual(current_hostname, self._other_hostname( source_hostname)) # the host running the instance should have resource usage current_rp_uuid = self._get_provider_uuid_by_host(current_hostname) current_usages = self._get_provider_usages(current_rp_uuid) self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor1, current_usages) allocations = self._get_allocations_by_server_uuid(server['id']) # NOTE(gibi): this is bug 1710249 where shelve offload doesn't free up # the resources self.assertEqual(2, len(allocations)) allocation = allocations[source_rp_uuid]['resources'] self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor1, allocation) allocation = allocations[current_rp_uuid]['resources'] self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor1, allocation) # NOTE(gibi): after fixing bug 1710249 the following should be true # self.assertEqual(1, len(allocations)) # allocation = allocations[current_rp_uuid]['resources'] # self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor1, allocation) self._delete_and_check_allocations( server, source_rp_uuid, source_rp_uuid) def test_shelve_offload_unshelve_same_host(self): source_hostname = self.compute1.host source_rp_uuid = self._get_provider_uuid_by_host(source_hostname) server = self._boot_then_shelve_and_check_allocations( source_hostname, source_rp_uuid) self._shelve_offload_and_check_allocations(server, source_rp_uuid) # unshelve after shelve offload will do scheduling. this test case # wants to test the scenario when the scheduler select the same host # to ushelve the instance. So we disable the other host. source_service_id = self.admin_api.get_services( host=self._other_hostname(source_hostname), binary='nova-compute')[0]['id'] self.admin_api.put_service(source_service_id, {'status': 'disabled'}) req = { 'unshelve': {} } self.api.post_server_action(server['id'], req) server = self._wait_for_state_change(self.api, server, 'ACTIVE') # unshelving an offloaded instance will call the scheduler so the # instance might end up on a different host current_hostname = server['OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host'] self.assertEqual(current_hostname, source_hostname) # the host running the instance should have resource usage current_rp_uuid = self._get_provider_uuid_by_host(current_hostname) current_usages = self._get_provider_usages(current_rp_uuid) # NOTE(gibi): this is bug 1710249 where shelve offload doesn't free up # the resources so the host now have doubled allocation self.assertFlavorsMatchAllocation( self.flavor1, self.flavor1, current_usages) # NOTE(gibi): after fixing bug 1710249 the following should be true # self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor1, current_usages) allocations = self._get_allocations_by_server_uuid(server['id']) self.assertEqual(1, len(allocations)) allocation = allocations[current_rp_uuid]['resources'] # NOTE(gibi): this is bug 1710249 where shelve offload doesn't free up # the resources so the host now have doubled allocation self.assertFlavorsMatchAllocation( self.flavor1, self.flavor1, allocation) # NOTE(gibi): after fixing bug 1710249 the following should be true # self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor1, allocation) self._delete_and_check_allocations( server, source_rp_uuid, source_rp_uuid)

commit_message:
delete allocation of evacuated instance

After evacuation the instance has allocations on both the source and
the destination computes. This is OK as the source compute is down.
However after the source compute is brought up the allocation from
the source host needs to be cleaned up.

Closes-Bug: #1709902
Change-Id: I0df401a7c91f012fdb25cb0e6b344ca51de8c309
(cherry picked from commit 9b9c2c52f323c536fb90bb29a40efbed1b129594)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/25/494625/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def delete_allocation_for_evacuated_instance(self, instance, node): # Clean up the instance allocation from this node in placement my_resources = scheduler_utils.resources_from_flavor( instance, instance.flavor) cn_uuid = self.compute_nodes[node].uuid res = self.reportclient.remove_provider_from_instance_allocation( instance.uuid, cn_uuid, instance.user_id, instance.project_id, my_resources) if not res: LOG.error("Failed to clean allocation of an evacuated " "instance on the source node %s", cn_uuid, instance=instance)

commit_message:
[reno] Add prelude for Pike release

This adds the Prelude section for the Pike release.

Change-Id: I60cf5c18540b6abb1ecd4c046ab1e51087c9aa77
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/06/493906/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- prelude: > The 8.0.1 (Pike) release includes many new features and bug fixes. Please review the upgrade section which describes the required actions to upgrade your installation from 7.0.x (Ocata) to 8.0.1 (Pike). A few major changes are worth mentioning. This is not an exhaustive list: - It is now possible to do rolling upgrades, starting with upgrading Ocata to Pike. For details, see https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/admin/upgrade-guide.html. - The long-awaited support to boot from volumes is here (TODO: mjturek is going to propose a patch for admin doc, add link here) - Support for "dynamic" drivers is available. All "classic" drivers have equivalent hardware types, and we encourage the use of the hardware types instead of the "classic" drivers. The hardware types available are: - ``cisco-ucs-standalone`` and ``cisco-ucs-managed`` to support Cisco UCS servers - ``idrac`` to support DELL EMC integrated DELL remote access controllers (iDRAC) (TODO: WILL IT LAND IN TIME?) - ``ilo`` to support iLO 4 based Proliant Gen 8 and Gen 9 servers - ``ipmi`` to support IPMI-compatible hardware - ``irmc`` to support FUJITSU PRIMERGY servers - ``oneview`` to support HPE OneView servers - ``redfish`` to support the Redfish standard - ``snmp`` to support SNMP powered systems - ``redfish`` is a new hardware type that supports the Redfish standard. (There is no equivalent "classic" driver for this.) - The Compute service is changing the way bare metal nodes are scheduled, and will be using the node's ``resource_class`` to do this. (TODO: is there documentation on this?) - The Bare Metal service can now incorporate physical network information when attaching virtual interfaces (VIFs) via the new ``physical_network`` field to the port object. For details, see https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/admin/multitenancy.html#multitenancy-physnets. - Port group information (``mode`` and ``properties`` fields) is now passed to the Network service via the (network) ports ``binding:profile`` field. This allows an ML2 driver to configure the port bonding automatically. - The ssh-based drivers have been removed from ironic. Please see the "Upgrade Notes" section for more information.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-15 17:20:40.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/settings'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/6160e48ed154fbbb0733610ecf7ba52a481b728b', 'message': "Make nova randomize the results of scheduling

Nova's [filter_scheduler]host_subset_size configuration option
allows to randomize the results of scheduling. In ironic jobs,
all the nodes are equally weighted, so the same ones are selected
over and over, and in case of parallel test runs (which happen in

commit_message:
Make nova randomize the results of scheduling

Nova's [filter_scheduler]host_subset_size configuration option
allows to randomize the results of scheduling. In ironic jobs,
all the nodes are equally weighted, so the same ones are selected
over and over, and in case of parallel test runs (which happen in
multinode grenade) this causes races between computes trying to
claim the same nodes.

Change-Id: I50540eaddcfb250254ab77a6b6a15e379db3d316
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/60/493960/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Avoid race in test_evacuate

We want the host to be the destination and the status to be active so
use _wait_for_server_parameter to wait on both of those, rather than
waiting only for the server to change to ACTIVE.

Without this, we sometimes see the server go ACTIVE but the host has
not yet changed.

Co-Authored-By: Balazs Gibizer <balazs.gibizer@ericsson.com>
Co-Authored-By: Chris Dent <cdent@anticdent.org>
Change-Id: I273998ebc03f3a832cc44787a5c2396da58e5e25
Closes-Bug: 1710509
(cherry picked from commit 548e93c4b45df05bb0352cc3ef6554d0f65870bd)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/24/494624/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: expected_params = {'OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host': dest_hostname, 'status': 'ACTIVE'} server = self._wait_for_server_parameter(self.api, server, expected_params)

commit_message:
Don't determine local IPv6 support if force_ip4=True

In case when user set in config to force usage of IPv4 shade
will not try to check if IPv6 is locally supported or not.

Change-Id: Id12df5de0de58bbe427301c8a32d4c622dfbcc99
Related-Bug: #2001001
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/19/494319/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._local_ipv6 = ( _utils.localhost_supports_ipv6() if not self.force_ipv4 else False)

commit_message:
fix the bug that cannot create a pool by openstacksdk

When I create a pool with a listener id or a loadbalance id, there is an
error with the message "Pool must be created with a loadbalancer or
listener." Then I find the code has no the parameter that
"loadbalancer_id".

I modify the pool class, I add new lines load_balancer_id =
resource.Body('loadbalancer_id'),listener_id =
resource.Body('listener_id'), then successfully create a pool.

Change-Id: I37f041de8284c23fdb3291d932548aa1a1a9f00a
Closes-Bug: 1711528
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/18/495118/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'protocol', 'provider', 'subnet_id', 'virtual_ip_id', 'listener_id', load_balancer_id='loadbalancer_id', #: ID of listener associated with this pool listener_id = resource.Body('listener_id') #: ID of load balancer associated with this pool load_balancer_id = resource.Body('loadbalancer_id')

commit_message:
test server evacuation with placement

This patch test evacuation between two Pike compute hosts and
checks the resource state in the placement API.

Related-Bug: #1709902

Change-Id: Idedb8a911a2ab0c096f4c9f61c5db362b08758ba
(cherry picked from commit 96938426e6351fd0ed0e485c04fccb11e37e91bc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/23/494623/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_evacuate(self): source_hostname = self.compute1.host dest_hostname = self.compute2.host server = self._boot_and_check_allocations( self.flavor1, source_hostname) source_compute_id = self.admin_api.get_services( host=source_hostname, binary='nova-compute')[0]['id'] self.compute1.stop() # force it down to avoid waiting for the service group to time out self.admin_api.put_service( source_compute_id, {'forced_down': 'true'}) # evacuate the server post = {'evacuate': {}} self.api.post_server_action( server['id'], post) server = self._wait_for_state_change(self.api, server, 'ACTIVE') self.assertEqual(dest_hostname, server['OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host']) # Expect to have allocation and usages on both computes as the # source compute is still down source_rp_uuid = self._get_provider_uuid_by_host(source_hostname) dest_rp_uuid = self._get_provider_uuid_by_host(dest_hostname) source_usages = self._get_provider_usages(source_rp_uuid) self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor1, source_usages) dest_usages = self._get_provider_usages(dest_rp_uuid) self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor1, dest_usages) allocations = self._get_allocations_by_server_uuid(server['id']) self.assertEqual(2, len(allocations)) source_allocation = allocations[source_rp_uuid]['resources'] self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor1, source_allocation) dest_allocation = allocations[dest_rp_uuid]['resources'] self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor1, dest_allocation) # start up the source compute self.compute1.start() self.admin_api.put_service( source_compute_id, {'forced_down': 'false'}) source_usages = self._get_provider_usages(source_rp_uuid) # NOTE(gibi): this is bug 1709902 as the source compute does not clean # up the allocation during init_host self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor1, source_usages) # after fixing bug 1709902 the following is expected # self.assertEqual({'VCPU': 0, # 'MEMORY_MB': 0, # 'DISK_GB': 0}, # source_usages) dest_usages = self._get_provider_usages(dest_rp_uuid) self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor1, dest_usages) allocations = self._get_allocations_by_server_uuid(server['id']) # NOTE(gibi): this is bug 1709902 as the source compute does not clean # up the allocation during init_host self.assertEqual(2, len(allocations)) source_allocation = allocations[source_rp_uuid]['resources'] self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor1, source_allocation) # after fixing bug 1709902 the following is expected # self.assertEqual(1, len(allocations)) dest_allocation = allocations[dest_rp_uuid]['resources'] self.assertFlavorMatchesAllocation(self.flavor1, dest_allocation) self._delete_and_check_allocations( server, source_rp_uuid, dest_rp_uuid)

information of reservations.

commit_message:
Use correct path in healthcheck scripts

Currently /usr/share/tripleo-common is used in healthcheck scripts,
but only /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-common is available in container
images

Closes-Bug: #1710629
Change-Id: Id7d169cfd34bf2a45e9bff0e389e77189cb774d7

commit_message:
add parameter to overwrite/add wsgi process options

    Add two parameters to apache wsgi to allow overwrite
    and/or add additional wsgi process options.

Change-Id: I41914ce3361988d5db1695f09d21209772fdf548
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib refs/changes/37/477137/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: describe 'when wsgi_daemon_process_options are overriden' do let :params do { :custom_wsgi_process_options => { user => 'someotherusser', python_path => '/my/python/admin/path', } } end it { is_expected.to contain_apache__vhost('keystone_wsgi').with( 'wsgi_daemon_process_options' => { 'user' => 'someotherusser', 'group' => 'keystone', 'processes' => 1, 'threads' => global_facts[:os_workers], 'display-name' => 'keystone_wsgi', 'python_path' => '/my/python/admin/path', }, )} end

commit_message:
Enable innodb_buffer_pool_size configuration

Adds a hiera-enabled setting for mysql.pp to
allow configuration of innodb_buffer_pool_size, a key
configurational element for MySQL performance tuning.

Change-Id: Iabdcb6f76510becb98cba35c95db550ffce44ff3
Closes-bug: #1704978
(cherry picked from commit 54532632aad311768b224bd92f42cf60dce84705)

added_lines: --- features: - | Enable innodb_buffer_pool_size configuration for all MySQL databases.

commit_message:
NSSDB invocation fix for Libreswan v3.19 and later

On the Jan 15, 2017 libreswan team released version 3.19 that introduced a change that requires to specify the flag --nssdir for NSS DB location.

Change-Id: I94f7096a0a757977eadc06b649a7c857083727ca
Closes-Bug: #1711456
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas refs/changes/07/495107/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Fixed for Libreswan v3.19+ try: self._execute([self.binary, 'checknss', '--nssdir', self.etc_dir]) except RuntimeError: self._execute([self.binary, 'initnss', '--nssdir', self.etc_dir])
deleted_lines: try: self._execute([self.binary, 'checknss', self.etc_dir]) except RuntimeError: self._execute([self.binary, 'initnss', self.etc_dir])

commit_message:
Windows: ensure exec calls don't block other greenthreads

eventlet.green.subprocess is not actually greenthread friendly on
Windows. It just uses the native subprocess.Popen in this case.

For this reason, exec calls do not yield on Windows, blocking other
greenthreads.

This change avoids this issue by wrapping the 'communicate' call
using eventlet.tpool.

We're also ensuring that subprocess.Popen uses *native* threads
internally in order to avoid deadlocks when passing data through
stdin.

Change-Id: Ic25fd1b61b5498f16e6049cbbe0877492f8aab4d
Closes-Bug: #1709586
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.concurrency refs/changes/81/492081/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: eventlet_patched = eventlet and eventlet.patcher.is_monkey_patched(time) if eventlet_patched: from eventlet import tpool # eventlet.green.subprocess is not really greenthread friendly # on Windows. In order to avoid blocking other greenthreads, # we have to wrap this call using tpool. if eventlet_patched and os.name == 'nt': result = tpool.execute(obj.communicate, process_input) else: result = obj.communicate(process_input)
deleted_lines: if eventlet and eventlet.patcher.is_monkey_patched(time): result = obj.communicate(process_input)

commit_message:
Ibm_storage - fix delete group with replication

Running delete_group fails with no details.
The reason for this is because there is no informative message
when the action fails.

commit_message:
Add before_end_date and before_end parameters

This patch adds a before_end_date option to the lease-create command. It
also adds a before_end parameter to the physical_reservation option.

Partially Implements: blueprint on-end-options
Depends-On: I90fb90d9d53814791d863f4ce5dab28388d3688d
Change-Id: I2a6f3477509f5b549edbdc25cb2c6ac457c7c100
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-blazarclient refs/changes/71/491671/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def create(self, name, start, end, reservations, events, before_end=None): 'reservations': reservations, 'events': events, 'before_end_date': before_end}
deleted_lines: def create(self, name, start, end, reservations, events): 'reservations': reservations, 'events': events}

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-24 03:29:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/blazar-nova/commit/bb25e16aca42fa9633745d45351b9bf3b4620c4e', 'message': 'Add instance reservation filtering in BlazarNova filter

To pass an instance reservation request, this commit adds instance
reservation filtering in BlazarNova filter.

Partially implements: blueprint new-instance-reservation

Change-Id: Ifb61a3f858f13a84b7a841068d13da7c56fda3af

BlazarFilter needs to filter hosts with following rules for the
new instance reservation feature:

- The filter returns True if a requested spec has a reservation attribute
  and a host is in the requested instance-reservation's aggregate.
- The filter returns False if a requested spec has a reservation attribute
  and a host is NOT in the requested isntance-reservation's aggregate.

This patch adds the filtering rules for the new instance reservaiton.

Partially implements: blueprint new-instance-reservation

commit_message:
Add instance reservation filtering in BlazarFilter

BlazarFilter needs to pass a host if the scheduling request is
related to the new instance reservation feature.

This patch adds filtering rules for the new instance reservation
feature.

Partially implements: blueprint new-instance-reservation
Change-Id: Ifb61a3f858f13a84b7a841068d13da7c56fda3af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar-nova refs/changes/76/486476/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: RESERVATION_PREFIX = 'reservation' FLAVOR_EXTRA_SPEC = "aggregate_instance_extra_specs:" + RESERVATION_PREFIX def instance_reservation_request(self, host_state, spec_obj): pools = self.fetch_blazar_pools(host_state) for aggregate in pools: if aggregate.name == spec_obj.flavor.id: return True return False # the request is instance reservaiton if FLAVOR_EXTRA_SPEC in spec_obj.flavor.extra_specs.keys(): return self.instance_reservation_request(host_state, spec_obj)

commit_message:
Add support for policy directories per service

This change introduces the POLICY_DIRS setting which adds the ability
to define multiple policy directories per service.

Blueprint: policy-dirs
Change-Id: Ie42f1aa68539b7388661ddfe2c265255cd574736
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/django_openstack_auth refs/changes/53/487153/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_policy_conf(policy_dirs=None): if policy_dirs is None: policy_dirs = [] policy_dirs = [os.path.join(_BASE_PATH, policy_dir) for policy_dir in policy_dirs] conf.set_default('policy_dirs', policy_dirs, 'oslo_policy') policy_dirs = getattr(settings, 'POLICY_DIRS', {}) conf = _get_policy_conf(policy_dirs=policy_dirs.get(service, []))

commit_message:
Remove usage of watcher modules

As DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_ALL_PLUGINS[1] is prohibited to use, we need to
remove any usage of original project modules.

[1]: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/tempest-separate-plugin

Change-Id: Ie2a87959e64b8db1401de01b1414324c79cf3024

subject: Fix determining if IPv6 is supported when it's disabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-16 20:38:47.000000000', 'files': ['shade/_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/shade/commit/89e07d905a94525a0813e6e467da9f5cd94a1c8d', 'message': "Fix determining if IPv6 is supported when it's disabled

On systems where IPv6 is completly disabled there can be
AttributeError when shade tries to determine if IPv6 is
supported or not on local system.
Now it's fixed by returning False always when AF_INET6
isn't available in netifaces.

Change-Id: I45138bd42cb63ff59b6aed85f33da11aab43aaba
Related-Bug: #2001001
"}]
commit_message:
Fix determining if IPv6 is supported when it's disabled

On systems where IPv6 is completly disabled there can be
AttributeError when shade tries to determine if IPv6 is
supported or not on local system.
Now it's fixed by returning False always when AF_INET6
isn't available in netifaces.

Change-Id: I45138bd42cb63ff59b6aed85f33da11aab43aaba
Related-Bug: #2001001
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/21/494321/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: return netifaces.AF_INET6 in netifaces.gateways()['default'] except AttributeError: return False

commit_message:
Role name is unique within the owning domain

Keytone supports to create roles with same name
in different domains, this patch revises the code
comment in heat.

Change-Id: Iacf281513fe2ea23202c943ad870fe21bb0c295d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/26/458426/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: the individual user or at the group level. Role names are unique within the owning domain.
deleted_lines: the individual user or at the group level. Role names are globally unique.

commit_message:
Revert "[reno] Add prelude for Pike release"

This reverts commit 7bb72eb9a2adbe72fdb0ecefc7f3cea65009040d.

Change-Id: I5e305c338f0a0a4cf9f1cc4ee761e410d05b27ca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/42/494542/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: --- prelude: | The 9.0.0 (Pike) release includes many new features and bug fixes. Please review the upgrade section which describes the required actions to upgrade your installation from 7.0.x (Ocata) to 9.0.0 (Pike). A few major changes are worth mentioning. This is not an exhaustive list: - It is now possible to do rolling upgrades, starting with upgrading Ocata to Pike. For details, see https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/admin/upgrade-guide.html. - The long-awaited support to boot from volumes is here. For details, see https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/admin/boot-from-volume.html. - Full support for "dynamic" drivers is available. There are hardware types for all "classic" drivers. The use of hardware types is preferred over the use of "classic" drivers, since "classic" drivers may be deprecated in Queens. - ``redfish`` is a new hardware type that supports the Redfish standard. - The Compute service is changing the way bare metal nodes are scheduled, and will be using the node's ``resource_class`` to do this. For more details, see https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/install/configure-nova-flavors.html#scheduling-based-on-resource-classes. - The Bare Metal service can now incorporate physical network information when attaching virtual interfaces (VIFs) via the new ``physical_network`` field to the port object. For details, see https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/admin/multitenancy.html#multitenancy-physnets. - The ssh-based drivers have been removed from ironic. Please see the "Upgrade Notes" section for more information.

commit_message:
Cache policy enforcer

The policy enforcer can be used as a global object, there is no create
one for every context creation. This caches the object in the module and
reuse it in context.

Change-Id: I03087b7bc139c8aaef95809043fc57f52b7900a1
Closes-Bug: #1658083
(cherry picked from commit 71c72340f58d28d7f865cb22917ecd18703cec74)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/54/487654/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ENFORCER = None def get_enforcer(): global ENFORCER if ENFORCER is None: ENFORCER = Enforcer() return ENFORCER

commit_message:
Add validation checks for the update form

Instance reservation does not support update of reservation currently.
This patch adds validation checks to the update form and hides
unsupported fields if the lease includes instance reservations.

Change-Id: I2cb51871ed4ff1d301569ee4a9be21be01aac263
Partially Implements: blueprint climate-dashboard
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar-dashboard refs/changes/29/490329/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __init__(self, request, *args, **kwargs): super(UpdateForm, self).__init__(request, *args, **kwargs) for reservation in kwargs['initial']['lease'].reservations: if reservation['resource_type'] == 'virtual:instance': # Hide unsupported fields del self.fields['start_time'] del self.fields['end_time'] return

commit_message:
Remove pbr warnerrors in favor of sphinx check

This change removes the now unused "warnerrors" setting,
which is replaced by "warning-is-error" in sphinx
releases >= 1.5 [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/
2017-March/113085.html

Change-Id: I990a76227481525c91b5ec8035c8295836f23afa

Fix paths to blazar-dashboard configuration files

Because links are relative to the openstack_dashboard/local/enabled
directory, several parent directories need to be traversed.

commit_message:
Move ODL repo enablement into base image

This makes it consistent with the rest of the images and lets kolla
users disable external repo in a clean fashion.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Andr <m.andre@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If6d03d2168a14181b7a32d7810b8fe4b1d798585
